+ ## ğŸš€ Core Web Vitals & Performance Excellence
+ 
+ ### Performance Budget Rules
+ - LCP (Largest Contentful Paint): < 2.5s
+ - FID (First Input Delay): < 100ms
+ - CLS (Cumulative Layout Shift): < 0.1
+ - TTFB (Time to First Byte): < 800ms
+ - Speed Index: < 3.4s
+ - Total Blocking Time: < 200ms
+ 
+ ### Frontend Performance Optimization
+ 
+ #### JavaScript Performance
+ - Bundle splitting by routes/features
+ - Dynamic imports for non-critical code
+ - Tree shaking for unused code elimination
+ - Service Workers for caching strategies
+ - Web Workers for heavy computations
+ - Intersection Observer for lazy loading
+ 
+ #### CSS Performance
+ - Critical CSS inlining
+ - Non-critical CSS lazy loading
+ - CSS containment for layout optimization
+ - CSS custom properties for better browser optimization
+ - Avoid @import in CSS (use bundler instead)
+ 
+ #### Image & Media Optimization
+ - WebP/AVIF formats with fallbacks
+ - Responsive images with srcset
+ - Lazy loading with intersection observer
+ - Image compression (80-85% quality)
+ - SVG optimization for icons
+ - Video: VP9/AV1 codecs preferred
+ 
+ ### Backend Performance Rules
+ 
+ #### Database Optimization
+ - Index optimization for queries
+ - Query batching and caching
+ - Connection pooling
+ - Read replicas for scaling
+ - Pagination for large datasets
+ - Avoid N+1 queries
+ 
+ #### Caching Strategies
+ - Multi-layer caching (Redis, CDN, Browser)
+ - Cache invalidation strategies
+ - ETag/Last-Modified headers
+ - Stale-while-revalidate patterns
+ - Service worker cache strategies
+ 
+ #### API Performance
+ - GraphQL query optimization
+ - REST API pagination
+ - Response compression (gzip/brotli)
+ - Keep-alive connections
+ - API rate limiting
+ - Background job processing
+ 
+ ### Memory Management
+ 
+ #### JavaScript Memory
+ - Avoid memory leaks in closures
+ - Proper event listener cleanup
+ - WeakMap/WeakSet for temporary references
+ - Object pooling for frequent allocations
+ - Monitoring with Performance API
+ 
+ #### Server Memory
+ - Memory profiling and monitoring
+ - Garbage collection optimization
+ - Memory-efficient data structures
+ - Stream processing for large data
+ 
+ ### Performance Monitoring
+ 
+ #### Real User Monitoring (RUM)

+ - Device/network condition analysis
+ 
+ #### Synthetic Monitoring

+ ### Performance Testing
+ 
+ #### Load Testing

+ ## ğŸ¯ Performance Anti-Patterns to Avoid
+ 
+ ### Frontend Anti-Patterns

+ - Synchronous XHR requests
+ - Excessive DOM manipulations
+ - Large bundle sizes
+ - Unoptimized images
+ - Memory leaks in SPAs
+

+ # security.mdc - ä¸–ç•Œæœ€é«˜ãƒ¬ãƒ™ãƒ« ã‚»ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒªãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ™ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ—ãƒ©ã‚¯ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¹

+ ## ğŸ“Š Observability Excellence Framework

+ - Apdex score (Application Performance Index)
+ 
+ #### Golden Signals
+ - **Latency**: Time to process requests
+ - **Traffic**: Demand on your system
+ - **Errors**: Rate of failed requests
+ - **Saturation**: Resource utilization

+ - Clear, measurable targets
+ - Business-aligned metrics
+ - Error budgets

function processPayment(amount) {

  const timer = histogram.startTimer();
  
  try {
    const result = processInternalPayment(amount);
    paymentSuccessCounter.inc();

    span.recordException(error);
    throw error;
  } finally {
    timer.observeDuration();
    span.end();
  }
}

- ## ğŸš€ Core Web Vitals & Performance Excellence
+ ## ğŸš€ Core Web Vitals
  
- ### Performance Budget Rules
- - LCP (Largest Contentful Paint): < 2.5s
- - FID (First Input Delay): < 100ms
- - CLS (Cumulative Layout Shift): < 0.1
- - TTFB (Time to First Byte): < 800ms
- - Speed Index: < 3.4s
- - Total Blocking Time: < 200ms
- 
- ### Frontend Performance Optimization
- 
- #### JavaScript Performance
- - Bundle splitting by routes/features
- - Dynamic imports for non-critical code
- - Tree shaking for unused code elimination
- - Service Workers for caching strategies
- - Web Workers for heavy computations
- - Intersection Observer for lazy loading
- 
- #### CSS Performance
- - Critical CSS inlining
- - Non-critical CSS lazy loading
- - CSS containment for layout optimization
- - CSS custom properties for better browser optimization
- - Avoid @import in CSS (use bundler instead)
- 
- #### Image & Media Optimization
- - WebP/AVIF formats with fallbacks
- - Responsive images with srcset
- - Lazy loading with intersection observer
- - Image compression (80-85% quality)
- - SVG optimization for icons
- - Video: VP9/AV1 codecs preferred
- 
- ### Backend Performance Rules
- 
- #### Database Optimization
- - Index optimization for queries
- - Query batching and caching
- - Connection pooling
- - Read replicas for scaling
- - Pagination for large datasets
- - Avoid N+1 queries
- 
- #### Caching Strategies
- - Multi-layer caching (Redis, CDN, Browser)
- - Cache invalidation strategies
- - ETag/Last-Modified headers
- - Stale-while-revalidate patterns
- - Service worker cache strategies
- 
- #### API Performance
- - GraphQL query optimization
- - REST API pagination
- - Response compression (gzip/brotli)
- - Keep-alive connections
- - API rate limiting
- - Background job processing
- 
- ### Memory Management
- 
- #### JavaScript Memory
- - Avoid memory leaks in closures
- - Proper event listener cleanup
- - WeakMap/WeakSet for temporary references
- - Object pooling for frequent allocations
- - Monitoring with Performance API
- 
- #### Server Memory
- - Memory profiling and monitoring
- - Garbage collection optimization
- - Memory-efficient data structures
- - Stream processing for large data
- 
- ### Performance Monitoring
- 
- #### Real User Monitoring (RUM)

- - User journey performance

- 
- #### Synthetic Monitoring
- - Lighthouse CI integration

- - Performance regression detection
- - Competitive benchmarking
-

- 
- #### Mobile-First Optimization

- - Progressive Web App features

- #### Load Testing

- - Canary deployments

- - Edge computing utilization
- 
- ## ğŸ¯ Performance Anti-Patterns to Avoid
- 
- ### Frontend Anti-Patterns
- - Blocking the main thread
- - Synchronous XHR requests
- - Excessive DOM manipulations
- - Large bundle sizes
- - Unoptimized images
- - Memory leaks in SPAs
- 
- ### Backend Anti-Patterns
- - Synchronous database calls
- - Missing database indexes
- - Oversized API responses
- - Poor caching strategies
- - Blocking I/O operations
- 
- ## ğŸ“Š Performance Metrics & Alerting
- 
- ### Key Metrics
- - 95th percentile response times
- - Error rate correlation
- - Throughput under load
- - Resource utilization
- - User satisfaction scores
- 
- ### Alerting Rules
- - Performance degradation > 20%
- - Error rate spike > 1%
- - Memory usage > 80%
- - CPU usage > 70%
- - Disk I/O saturation

+ **ãƒ‘ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒ³ã‚¹æœ€é©åŒ–ã¯ç¶™ç¶šçš„ãªãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚»ã‚¹ã§ã™ã€‚ãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¶ãƒ¼ä½“é¨“ã®å‘ä¸Šã‚’å¸¸ã«æ„è­˜ã—ã€ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã«åŸºã¥ã„ãŸæ”¹å–„ã‚’ç¶šã‘ã‚‹ã“ã¨ãŒé‡è¦ã§ã™ã€‚**

+ #   intended to run in multiple environments; otherwise, check them in:
+ # .python-version
+ 
+ # pipenv
+ #   According to pypa/pipenv#598, it is recommended to include Pipfile.lock in version control.
+ #   However, in case of collaboration, if having platform-specific dependencies or dependencies
+ #   having no cross-platform support, pipenv may install dependencies that don't work, or not
+ #   install all needed dependencies.
+ #Pipfile.lock
+ 
+ # poetry
+ #   Similar to Pipfile.lock, it is generally recommended to include poetry.lock in version control.
+ #   This is especially recommended for binary packages to ensure reproducibility, and is more
+ #   commonly ignored for libraries.
+ #   https://python-poetry.org/docs/basic-usage/#commit-your-poetrylock-file-to-version-control
+ #poetry.lock
+ 
+ # pdm
+ #   Similar to Pipfile.lock, it is generally recommended to include pdm.lock in version control.
+ #pdm.lock
+ #   pdm stores project-wide configurations in .pdm.toml, but it is recommended to not include it
+ #   in version control.
+ #   https://pdm.fming.dev/#use-with-ide
+ .pdm.toml
